title: The Oregon Trail: Meeker Markers
name: The Oregon Trail: Meeker Markers
description:
A Map by Askwsl

&lt;a href=&quot;http://platial.com/mapawards/2007&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;http://platial.com/images/mapaward_badges/mapaward_mention_history.png&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;This map describes historical markers associated with Ezra Meeker and his 1906-1908 Old Oregon Trail Monument Expedition.  The locations are based on &quot;&lt;i&gt;The Missing Chapters: The Untold Story of Ezra Meeker's Old Oregon Trail Monument Expedition January 1906-July 1908&lt;/i&gt;&quot; by Dennis M. Larsen.  For more information on Ezra Meeker, check out &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.secstate.wa.gov/history/publications_detail.aspx?p=8&quot;&gt; Ox Team Days on the Oregon Trail &lt;/a&gt; by Ezra Meeker.  

Other sources of information include &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.octa-trails.org/&quot;&gt;The Oregon- California Trails Association,&lt;/a&gt; the &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.meekermansion.org/&quot;&gt; Ezra Meeker Historical Society, &lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.historylink.org/This_week/index.cfm&quot;&gt; HistoryLink.org&lt;/a&gt;.

For more information about the Oregon Trail, Ezra Meeker, or Washington State history, contact the &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.secstate.wa.gov/library/&quot;&gt;Washington State Library&lt;/a&gt;: askalibrarian@secstate.wa.gov

properties.name: American Falls Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1915. "It is located on the corner of Falls Avenue and Bridge Street, sitting in a desolate gravel lot overlooking the dam and the Snake River." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Baker City Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 19, 1906. "It is located in the city park across the street from the Oregon Trail Regional Museum." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Boise Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslBoise, IDMay 9, 1906. "It is located on the State Capitol grounds. The shaft is 10-12 feet tall." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Bush Prairie DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslSeptember 6, 1916. "It is located at 8820 Capitol Blvd. (Old Highway 99), east of the Olympia Municipal Airport, on the east side of the road near the intersection with 88th Ave. SE." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Casper Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFebruary 1911. "It is located on the east side of North Center Street just south of East B Street. It is across the street from the Casper City and County Building." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Centralia DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOctober 12, 1916. "It is located in Fort Borst Park in front of the Joseph Borst family home." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Chehalis Lewis County Historical Society Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl2006. "It will be located on Market Street, at the foot of the hill below City Hall, the site Ezra originally suggested." Larsen p. 124

properties.name: Claquato Lewis County Historical Society Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl2006. "It will be located in front of the Claquato Church." Larsen p. 124.

properties.name: Cokeville Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1906. "It is located on the southeast corner of U.S. Highway 30 and State Route 232 in Cokeville." Larsen p. 121

properties.name: Douglas State of Wyoming Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslSeptember 20, 1913. "It is located south of Douglas on the south side of State Route 91, 3.8 miles south of State Route 96." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Durkee Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslDurkee, ORAround May 1, 1906. "It is located on old Highway 30 in Durkee next to a power pole a short way west of the old school. There are plans to move it to the school yard to the south." (Larsen p.121)

properties.name: Flagstaff Hill Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFlagstaff Hill, April 19, 1906. "It is located on the grounds of the Oregon Trail Interpretive Center. From the Center a trail leads down the hill to the marker. A covered wagon exhibit is nearby." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Fort Boise Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFort Boise, after July 17, 1906. "Follow Highway 201 five miles south of Nyssa, Oregon. An interpretive kiosk describes the Snake River Crossing. The stone stands by the kiosk." (Larsen p. 121)

properties.name: Fort Hall Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFort Hall, IDJune 1907. "Visitors must make arrangements with the Fort Hall Reservation Tribal Council to visit the site. It is closed to the general public." Larsen p. 121/

properties.name: Glen Rock Marker #1
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1913. "...near milepost 171 on the old "Glenrock Highway (U.S. 26). This is 4.7 miles from the west edge of Glenrock or 2.7 miles west of the Ringo-Parker grave site. Turn north on a gravel road. In 0.7 mile, turn west. The marker is 100 yards down this road." It is next to the grave of the child, Ada [Magill], and a pony express marker. It is a reddish colored stone about 3 feet tall. The grave is enclosed by a fence. The Oregon Trail is about fifty feet south of this spot." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Glen Rock Marker #2
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1913. "The second marker is located south of the Dave Johnson Power plant at a small turnout near the A.H. Unthank grave marker just east of Glenrock on a spur road off of U.S. Highway 26 near the power plant." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Glen Rock Marker #3
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1913. "The third marker is on the east side of State Route 94 (Esterbrook Road) about 10 miles south of Riverbend Road." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Glen Rock Marker #4
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1913. "The fourth marker is about 10.6 miles south of Riverbend Drive on State Route 94 (Esterbrook Road). Turn east and follow a dirt road 1.9 miles until reaching old LaBonte Stage Station and stream crossing. The marker is 6 miles further. The marker is on private land. Permission is required to visit." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Glen Rock Marker #5
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1913. "The fifth marker is between Glenrock and Douglas on the east side of the Natural Land Bridge Road 2.6 miles south of I-25. This is where the Oregon Trail crosses the Natural Bridge Road." Larsen p. 122-3

properties.name: Gothenberg State of Nebraska Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1912. "To find it drive south from town on State Highway 47. Cross the Platte River and continue south about 1 mile from the river. The marker is located on the west side of the road about 100 yards north of Road 763 & the 96 Ranches sign." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #1
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1933 W. Campus Drive, shelton, NEJuly 4, 1923. "At the Platte Valley Academy campus at the extreme west edge of Hall County at 19338 W. Campus Drive Shelton, Nebraska. The academy is just east of Shelton off U.S. 30. Drive into campus and it is at the corner of PVA Drive and West Campus Drive. Next to it is a sign that reads, \'1923 Stone Trail Marker Wood River Valley Historical Society.\'" Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #2
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJuly 4, 1923. "On the west side of Highway 11 just north of the Wood River city limits. It is just before the school at the corner of [Green Street] and Highway 11...Next to it is a sign that reads, \'1923 Stone Trail Marker Wood River Valley Historical Society.\'" Larsen p. 124

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #3
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJuly 4, 1923. "On the west side of Alda Road, 1 mile south of Alda --ruts may be seen behind the sign."

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #4
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl3133 W US Hwy 34, Grand Island, NEJuly 4, 1923. "At the Stuhr Museum east of Fonner Pavilion. Take exit 312 off I-80. Go 4 miles north to the intersection of Highway 281 & Highway 34. The marker is near the Indian earth lodge exhibit and the tee pee." Larsen p. 124.

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #5
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJuly 4, 1923. "At the corner of Riverside Drive and Stagecoach Road in a residential neighborhood north of Riverside Golf Course." Larsen p. 124.

properties.name: Grand Island Hall County Historical Society Marker #6
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJuly 4, 1923. "At the corner of Seedling Mile Road and Gunbarrel Road." Larsen p. 124

properties.name: Grand Mound DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOctober 12, 1916. "It is located on the corner of Highway [12] and Grand Mound Way. It is on the west side of the road in a small landscaped area next to the Suburban Propane Store." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Huntington Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 26, 1906. "It is located in a tiny city park at the corner of 3rd St. W. and W. Washington." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Independence Rock Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl"Independence Rock is a marker in its own right. Ezra chiseled his logo on it on July 3, 1906. There is an interpretive panel directly in front of the chiseled inscription." Larsen p. 121

properties.name: Jackson's Prairie DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOctober 21, 1916. "It is located in front of the Matilda N. Jackson State Park. This is just north of the historic 1847 Jackson Courthouse and home. It is one the west side of the Jackson Highway (Old 99), 1/8 mile north of U.S. Highway 12." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Jett Farm - MISSING Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 25, 1906. "Take exit 340 eastbound off I-84 in Lime, Oregon. Follow the unpaved county road that parallels the Burnt River going north to the private farm at the end of the road. Somewhere along this gravel road Ezra set the marker." (Larsen p. 120)

properties.name: Kearney DAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFebruary 14, 1910. "It is at the intersection of Central Avenue and North Railroad Street." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: LaGrande Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 10, 1906. "It is located on the corner of B and Walnut Streets, in the front yard of the private residence there." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Lower Ladd's Canyon MISSING Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 11, 1906. "It was located about .25 miles east of Pierce Road on Hot Lake Lane. Look for a pile of rocks in some brush on the north side of the road. It stood there." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Meacham Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 6, 1906. "It is located at the entrance to Emigrant Springs State Park. It sits to the left of the entrance in a little hollow about 20 feet off the road, by a little seep that is all that is left of the original springs." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Montpelier Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJuly 24, 1907. "It is located at the front entrance of the National Oregon/California Trail Center." Larsen p. 122

properties.name: North Platte State of Nebraska Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1914. "This marker is located south of North Platte. At the I-80 and Highway 83 intersection, head about 1 miles south to State Farm Road. Take a right turn, go one block, and the marker is in the southwest corner of the W. State Farm Road and S. Willow Street intersection." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Omaha DAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl1914. "Located in Riverside park is a stone monument marking the beginning of the \'California\' Trail. A second DAR \'California\' Trail monument is located in Bemis Park." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Parma Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOrdered May 5, 1906. Probably replaced with current stone at a later time. "It is located on the grounds of the replica of Old Fort Boise in Parma. This is on U.S. Highway 26/30 just east of town." Larsen p. 121

properties.name: Pendleton Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by Askwsl2500 Westgate, Pendleton, ORMarch 31, 1906. "It is located at the entrance to the Eastern Oregon Correctional Institution. This is on the west side of town on U.S. Highway 30. It sits to the right of the Correctional Institution sign at the main entrance." Larsen p. 119-120

properties.name: Pocatello Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslJune 1907. "It is located inside the gate of the Fort Hall Replica in Pocatello." Larsen p. 121

properties.name: South Boise Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslSouth Boise, ordered May 9, 1906. "It is located on the corner of Broadway and Boise Avenues. There is a small mini-park on the NW corner of the intersection diagonally across from the school." (Larsen p. 121)

properties.name: South Pass Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslSouth Pass, June 24, 1906. "On Highway 28 find the rest area by the Sweetwater Bridge. Go south up the hill .7 miles and turn left onto Oregon Buttes Road. Drive about 3 miles to an intersection with a rutted dirt road. This is the Oregon Trail. Go about 1 mile on the rutted road to the marker." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Straw Creek Ranch Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslStraw Creek Ranch, April 21, 1906. "Going eastbound on I-84 take the Mt. Pleasant exit and follow Old Highway 30 several miles until it crosses under the freeway to the west side...Look for a tunnel going east under I-84 providing access to the privately owned Straw Creek Ranch. Go through the tunnel. This is a county road. The marker is in front of the farm house." Larsen p. 120

properties.name: Tenino Meeker Marker #1
properties.description: Posted by AskwslFebruary 21, 1906. "It is located on the main road through town (Old Highway 99), also called Sussex Ave. E. at the corner of Sheridan St. N." Larsen p. 119

properties.name: The Dalles Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslMarch 12, 1906. "It is located in a city park at 6th and Union Streets." Larsen p. 119

properties.name: Toledo DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOctober 21, 1916. "It is located on the corner N. Fifth and St. Helens and the Jackson Highway (Old 99). It is just before the \'Welcome to Toledo\' sign. It is on a little grass island where all three streets merge." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Tumwater DAR/SAR Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslAugust 15, 1916. "It is located on the corner of Boston St. SW and Deschutes Way SW, at the west end of the Deschutes River Bridge about 200 feet from the Tumwater Falls Park." Larsen p. 123

properties.name: Twin Falls Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslOrdered July 17, 1906, erected 1910. "It stands at the entranced to Rock Creek Park, which is about a mile west of downtown Twin Falls off U.S. Highway 30/93, West Addison Ave." Larsen p. 121

properties.name: Upper Ladd's Canyon - MISSING Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 12, 1906. "About 5 miles up the freeway toward Baker City from the rest area at the I-84 and Foothill Road intersection at the mouth of the canyon look for a frontage road on your right. The marker was placed where the freeway makes a bend by the frontage road." (Larsen p. 121)

properties.name: Vale Meeker Marker
properties.description: Posted by AskwslApril 30, 1906. "It is located in front of the County Courthouse in Vale." Larsen p. 120
